newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - June 25.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - June 25.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
The fire at Magurchhara gas field would die down automatically, said Occidental officials on Tuesday.
The Election Commission has suggested that ministers of the ruling Awami League should not participate in campaign in the Manikganj constituency where a parliamentary by-elections is due on June 30.

The Parbattya Chattagram Janasanghati Samity (PCJSS), the political wing of tribal Shanti Bahini insurgents, is seeking the opinion of its rank and file about a possible peace agreement with the government.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina told the parliament on Tuesday that the amount of default bank loans was coming down because of stern actions by the government.
Main opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) will stage countrywide demonstration on Thursday against the 1997/98 budget which it alleged was desinged to protect Indian business interest.
Former Prsident Hussain Muahammad Ershad was released on Tuesday from a heart hospital where he was admitted with severe chest pain last week.
Finance Minister S.A.M.S. Kibria on Tuesday told representatives of international donors that the government was committed to carry forward administrative, economic and legal reforms.
German company ABB has won a Taka 2.97 billion deal for installing 151 kilometre power tramission line in Chittagong region. REUTER
